page.title: 11VILLAGE LIFE IN GUARLFORD
page.content: The village is a settlement of less than 100 people,the majority living in houses built after the Second World War.Most people work in{Great Malvern (three miles to the West) where the largest employer is the{Royal Signals {and Radar Establishment. The village has been left with few{amenities.}The {school}closed during the 1950's and is now two houses.The{Rectory}nearby has been converted to private use and the {vicar}is 'shared' with the{Parish of {Madresfield. There no longer any{shops in Guarlford apart from a{nursery based on Grange Farm.Two{Public {Houses,}the{Green Dragon}and the {Plough and Harrow}are a mile away in either direction from the centre of the village.
